Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior black with one band of added red lined in white; exterior, yellow-cream slip; large lotus-flower and palmette; added red on the petals of the lotus-flower and on alternate petals of palmette; spotted vertical band at right break that probably divides the two halves of the palmette; below, black-brown zone with added white and red horizontal stripes. Drill-hole in broken edge from sampling for clay analysis. Red-brown clay with some lime lime inclusions and moderate amounts of small silver mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 27)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.257)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.4; p.663, pl.8.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
